paper_abstract: Answering a problem posed by Nakhleh, we prove that counting the number of phylogenetic trees inferred by a (binary) phylogenetic network is #P-complete. An immediate consequence of this result is that counting the number of phylogenetic trees commonly inferred by two (binary) phylogenetic networks is also #P-complete.
paper_title: COUNTING TREES IN A PHYLOGENETIC NETWORK IS #P-COMPLETE
